definitions.definition: a two-piece swimming costume for women.
definitions.example: Karen put on a yellow sun dress over her bikini

definitions.definition: a distinctive attribute or aspect of something.
definitions.example: a well-appointed house with interesting decorative features

definitions.definition: a newspaper or magazine article or a broadcast programme devoted to the treatment of a particular topic, typically at length.
definitions.example: a special feature on children's reference books

definitions.definition: used to refer to one or some of a thing or number of things, no matter how much or how many.
definitions.example: I don't have any choice

definitions.definition: whichever of a specified class might be chosen.
definitions.example: these constellations are visible at any hour of the night

definitions.definition: at all; in some degree (used for emphasis).
definitions.example: he wasn't any good at basketball

definitions.definition: be incompatible or at variance; clash.
definitions.example: parents' and children's interests sometimes conflict

definitions.definition: a serious disagreement or argument, typically a protracted one.
definitions.example: the eternal conflict between the sexes

definitions.definition: physical strength and force exerted by something or someone.
definitions.example: the power of the storm

definitions.definition: the ability or capacity to do something or act in a particular way.
definitions.example: the power of speech

definitions.definition: the capacity or ability to direct or influence the behaviour of others or the course of events.
definitions.example: a political process that offers people power over their own lives

definitions.definition: energy that is produced by mechanical, electrical, or other means and used to operate a device.
definitions.example: generating power from waste

definitions.definition: move or travel with great speed or force.
definitions.example: he powered round a bend

definitions.definition: supply (a device) with mechanical or electrical energy.
definitions.example: the car is powered by a fuel-injected 3.0-litre engine

definitions.definition: the foremost line or part of an armed force; the furthest position that an army has reached and where the enemy is or may be engaged.
definitions.example: his regiment was immediately sent to the front

definitions.definition: an appearance or form of behaviour assumed by a person to conceal their genuine feelings.
definitions.example: she put on a brave front

definitions.definition: boldness and confidence of manner.
definitions.example: he's got a bit of talent and a lot of front

definitions.definition: of or at the front.
definitions.example: the front cover of the magazine

definitions.definition: (of a building or piece of land) have the front facing or directed towards.
definitions.example: the flats which fronted Crow Road

definitions.definition: provide (something) with a front or facing of a particular type or material.
definitions.example: a metal box fronted by an alloy panel

definitions.definition: lead or be the most prominent member in (an organization, group, or activity).
definitions.example: the group is fronted by two girl singers

definitions.definition: act as a front or cover for illegal or secret activity.
definitions.example: he fronted for them in illegal property deals

definitions.definition: the side or part of an object that presents itself to view or that is normally seen or used first; the most forward part of something.
definitions.example: a page at the front of the book had been torn out

definitions.definition: using or involving physical force intended to hurt, damage, or kill someone or something.
definitions.example: a violent confrontation with riot police

definitions.definition: (especially of an emotion or a destructive natural force) very strong or powerful.
definitions.example: violent dislike

definitions.definition: insignificant; unimportant.
definitions.example: these are small points

definitions.definition: into small pieces.
definitions.example: cut the okra up small

definitions.definition: of a size that is less than normal or usual.
definitions.example: the room was small and quiet

definitions.definition: (in real tennis) each of the winning openings in the court.
a gambling game using two dice, in which the chances are complicated by arbitrary rules.
a danger or risk.
definitions.example: the hazards of childbirth

definitions.definition: say (something) in a tentative way.
definitions.example: he hazarded a guess

definitions.definition: put (something) at risk of being lost.
definitions.example: the cargo business is too risky to hazard money on

definitions.definition: an ambiguity or inadequacy in the law or a set of rules.
definitions.example: they exploited tax loopholes

definitions.definition: make arrow slits in (a wall).
definitions.example: the walls of the barracks were loopholed for muskets

definitions.definition: an intense feeling of fear, shock, or disgust.
definitions.example: children screamed in horror

definitions.definition: express complete disapproval of; censure.
definitions.example: most leaders roundly condemned the attack

definitions.definition: sentence (someone) to a particular punishment, especially death.
definitions.example: the rebels had been condemned to death

definitions.definition: officially declare (something) to be unfit for use.
definitions.example: the pool has been condemned as a health hazard

definitions.definition: remove or take out, especially by effort or force.
definitions.example: the fossils are extracted from the chalk

definitions.definition: a short passage taken from a text, film, or piece of music.
definitions.example: an extract from a historical film

definitions.definition: a preparation containing the active ingredient of a substance in concentrated form.
definitions.example: natural plant extracts

definitions.definition: the development of events outside a person's control, regarded as predetermined by a supernatural power.
definitions.example: fate decided his course for him

definitions.definition: be destined to happen, turn out, or act in a particular way.
definitions.example: the regime was fated to end badly

definitions.definition: Greek & Roman Mythology
definitions.example: the Fates might decide that it was his time to die

definitions.definition: extremely good; outstanding.
definitions.example: the lorry was in excellent condition

definitions.definition: used to indicate approval or pleasure.
definitions.example: √¢¬Ä¬òWhat a lovely idea! Excellent!√¢¬Ä¬ô

definitions.definition: an involuntary quivering movement.
definitions.example: a disorder that causes tremors and muscle rigidity

definitions.definition: undergo a tremor or tremors.
definitions.example: a muscle in my jaw tremored uncontrollably

definitions.definition: a slight earthquake.
definitions.example: the epicentre of the tremor was 65 miles north of LA

definitions.definition: a barrier or restriction to an action or advance.
definitions.example: political differences are not necessarily a bar to a good relationship

definitions.definition: a partition in a court room, now usually notional, beyond which most people may not pass and at which an accused person stands.
definitions.example: the prisoner at the bar

definitions.definition: the profession of barrister.
definitions.example: his dismissal from the Singapore Bar

definitions.definition: a unit of pressure equivalent to a hundred thousand newtons per square metre or approximately one atmosphere.
Baruch (Apocrypha) (in biblical references).
prevent or prohibit (someone) from doing something or from going somewhere.
definitions.example: journalists had been barred from covering the elections

definitions.definition: mark (something) with bars or stripes.
definitions.example: his face was barred with light

definitions.definition: except for.
definitions.example: his kids were all gone now, bar one

definitions.definition: a counter in a pub, restaurant, or cafe across which drinks or refreshments are served.
definitions.example: standing at the bar

definitions.definition: fasten (something, especially a door or window) with a bar or bars.
definitions.example: she bolted and barred the door

definitions.definition: a long rigid piece of wood, metal, or similar material, typically used as an obstruction, fastening, or weapon.
definitions.example: an iron bar

definitions.definition: a piece of enclosed land planted with fruit trees.
definitions.example: an apple orchard

definitions.definition: (of food or drink) sweet with a bitter aftertaste.
definitions.example: she sipped the bittersweet drink

definitions.definition: a heavily built omnivorous nocturnal mammal of the weasel family, typically having a grey and black coat.
